Hello World!

Computer Science // French // Coffee(script)

About Me

Hey, I'm Andrew. I've spent the last 3 years all over the place, so I'll give you a run through.

  • Jacksonville, FL: Home sweet home. Graduated from Stanton College Preparatory in 2014 with an IB Diploma thankfully.
  • Tuscaloosa, AL: Currently a 19 (or 20) year old undergraduate at the University of Alabama majoring in Computer Science and French. Alabama told me they would cover my tuition, so I said yes to free education and no to student debt. I've been learning programming and software design while keeping myself sane by taking coursework in French. I have about 2 more semesters till I finish the French part of my degree, and 2 years until I graduate. Learned C as my first programming language, then moved to C++, Java, SQL, javascript, and Ruby.
  • Tours, France: I spent a summer at L'institut Touraine, a school for foreigners to learn french, in 2015. Had a brief stint in Belgium but that was more for pleasure than education. Fueled my love of France and brought my total number of years studying the language to 6.
  • Atlanta, GA: Currently employed by Polytron, inc, as a co-op where I design networking solutions for manufacturers. Here I learned about the wonders of PLC Ladder Logic and became very proficient in using MSSMS/Database Management.

TL:DR; I'm passionate about languages, spoken or typed, and my education path has been in their pursuit.
